newsitem.title: UK: ICI bounces after results, spin-off plan.
newsitem.headline: ICI bounces after results, spin-off plan.

text.p: Shares in Imperial Chemical Industries Plc were marked higher in early trading on Thursday after the company posted results at the low end of expectations but said conditions should improve in the second half of 1997.
It also announced plans to spin off its Tioxide operations. The stock, under pressure in recent months, was up 10-1/2p at 775 by 0803 GMT.
"People like the Tioxide float, they see it as a positive move, and now 1996 is out of the way things could start to improve," said one senior trader.
ICI posted a drop in annual pre-tax pre-exceptional profit to 603 million stg from 951 million a year before, before net one-off charges totalling 137 million stg versus 94 million a year earlier.
Analysts had forecast the pre-tax pre-exceptional profits mostly in a range from 605 million stg to 650 million.

The past year had been a difficult one for the global chemical industry, ICI said, with "significant downward presure on prices and margins", though paints had performed "exceptionally well" with profits up 60 percent.
The full-year dividend was raised 6.7 percent to 32p.
It said the economic outlook for 1997 was better, with the major destocking that took place during 1996 believed to have come to an end.

The effects of higher oil prices, sterling strength and depressed chemical prices will continue to be felt in the first half of the current year, ICI said, though some improvement was expected in the second half.
